akamai.fallback: Message is not configured for the path.

global.400: Bad request. Check your input and try again.
global.403: Access forbidden. You don't have access to this resource. Contact your account administrator.
global.500: Internal server error. Try again later.
global.504: Gateway timeout error. Try again later.
global.initEdgeRc: Check if your .edgerc file and its section are specified correctly and contain valid credentials.
global.fieldsNotRequired: Arguments' and flags' values don't need to be provided with stdin.

diagnostics.long: The Diagnostics CLI allows you to diagnose server, ESI, DNS, and network issues Akamai customers experience when delivering content to their users.
diagnostics.section: Section of the .edgerc file with credentials to use.
diagnostics.accountKey: Account ID to switch to when performing the commands.

verifyIp.short: Verifies whether IP addresses are edge server IPs.
verifyIp.long: Verifies whether IP addresses are part of the Akamai network. You can enter up to 10 IP addresses.
verifyIp.ipAddress: Up to 10 IP addresses you want to get the data for.

invalid.ipAddress: At lease one IP address is invalid. Verify the input and try again.

verifyIp.failedIps: Failed to get results for IPs:

locateIp.short: Provides information about IP addresses' network and their location.
locateIp.long: Provides the geolocation data of IP addresses' network and their network details. You can enter up to 10 IPs.
locateIp.defaultError: Failed to get the geolocation data.
locateIp.ipAddress: Up to 10 IP addresses you want to get the data for.

invalid.ipAddress: At lease one IP address is invalid. Verify the input and try again.

locateIp.failedIps: Failed to get results for IPs:

verifyLocateIp.short: Verifies if an IP is an edge server IP and gets geolocation data for its network.
verifyLocateIp.long: Verifies if an IP is an edge server IP and gets geolocation data for its network.
verifyLocateIp.defaultError: Failed to verify and get geolocation data.
verifyLocateIp.ipAddress: IP address you want to get the data for.

invalid.ipAddress: Invalid IP address. Verify the input and try again.

curl.short: Uses the cURL command to get a raw HTML and response headers from locations or edge servers closest to a client.
curl.long: Uses the cURL command to get a raw HTML and response headers from locations or edge servers closest to a client. Making an HTTP request from an edge server lets you gather information about the HTTP response.
curl.url: URL you want to get the data for.
curl.clientLocation: Optional. Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your users. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command. Provide either this flag or '--edge-server-ip'.
curl.edgeServerIp: Optional. IP of an edge server to use to run the command. If you don't know if an IP is the edge IP, run the 'verify-ip' command. Provide either this flag or '--client-location'.
curl.ipVersion: Optional. IP version to use to run the command, either 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. By default set to 'IPV4'.
curl.requestHeader: Optional. Customized headers for the cURL request in the format 'header: value'. You can provide multiple values.
curl.runFromSiteShieldMap: Optional. Runs the command from Site Shield.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.

invalid.exclusive: Invalid combination of flags. You need to provide only one of these flags, either '--client-location' or '--edge-server-ip'.
invalid.edgeServerIp: Invalid edge server IP value. Verify the input and try again. To verify if an IP is an edge server IP, run the 'verify-ip' command.
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'.

dig.short: Uses the dig command to provide DNS details for the location of an edge server, a hostname or a domain name, or a GTM hostname.
dig.long: Uses the dig command to provide DNS details for the location of an edge server, a hostname or a domain name, or a GTM hostname. The results may help you diagnose issues with domain name resolutions. You can run this command either for a specific location or an edge IP.
dig.hostname: Hostname, a domain name, or a GTM hostname you want to get the data for. To get available GTM hostnames, run the 'gtm-hostnames' command.
dig.clientLocation: Optional. Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your users. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command first. You need to provide either this flag or '--edge-server-ip'.
dig.edgeServerIp: Optional. IP of an edge server you want to run the dig command from. If you don't know if an IP is the edge IP, run the 'verify-ip' command. You need to provide either this flag or '--client-location'.
dig.queryType: Optional. DNS record type you want to get. Possible values are: 'A', 'AAAA', 'SOA', 'CNAME', 'PTR', 'MX', 'NS', 'TXT', 'SRV', 'CAA', and 'ANY'. By default set to 'A'.
dig.gtm: Optional. Specifies that the provided hostname is a GTM hostname.

missing.hostname: Missing the required '--hostname' flag. Add the flag and try again.

invalid.hostName: Invalid hostname value. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.edgeServerIp: Invalid edge server IP value. Verify the input and try again. To verify if an IP is an edge server IP, run the 'verify-ip' command.
invalid.clientLocation: Invalid client location value. Verify the input and try again. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command.
invalid.queryType: Invalid query type value. Available values are: 'A', 'AAAA', 'SOA', 'CNAME', 'PTR', 'MX', 'NS', 'TXT', 'SRV', 'CAA', and 'ANY'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.isGtmHostName: Invalid '--gtm' flag value. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.exclusive: Invalid combination of flags. You need to provide only one of these flags, either '--client-location' and '--edge-server-ip'.

estats.short: Returns HTTP status codes distribution statistics from delivering a URL or CP code based on the 9-second traffic sample from the last 2 minutes.
estats.long: Provides statistics of errors happening on a URL or CP codeâ€™s traffic. The command returns also logs for the edge server response to a client and the edge server forward request to an origin server and error details. Errors' data are based on the 9-second traffic sample from the last 2 minutes.
estats.defaultError: Failed to get error statistics and details.
estats.url: Fully qualified URL you want to get the data for. You need to provide either this flag or '--cp-code'.
estats.cpCode: CP code you want to get the data for. You need to provide either this flag or '--url'.
estats.logs: Optional. Includes error logs in the response.
estats.enhancedTls: Optional. Gets error statistics for the Enhanced TLS delivery type. If neither this nor the '--standard-tls' flag is added, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by your resource and returns data for it. If your resource uses both delivery types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty. To verify the delivery type of your resource, you can use the Edge hostnames application in Control Center.
estats.standardTls: Optional. Gets error statistics for the Standard TLS delivery type. If neither this nor the '--enhanced-tls' flag is added, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by your resource and returns data for it. If your resource uses both delivery types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty. To verify the delivery type of your resource, you can use the Edge hostnames application in Control Center.
estats.edgeErrors: Optional. Requests details for errors from client to edge server. Without this or the '--origin-error' flag, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both directions, from client to edge server and from edge to origin server.
estats.originErrors: Optional. Requests details for errors from edge to origin server. Without this or the '--edge-error' flag, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both directions, from client to edge server and from edge to origin server.

missing.any: Missing one of the required flags, either '--url' or '--cp-code'. Add the flag and try again.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.exclusive: Invalid combination of flags. You need to provide only one of these flags, either '--url' or '--cp-code'.
invalid.exclusiveDelivery: Invalid combination of flags. Provide only one of these flags, either '--enhanced-tls' or '--standard-tls'.

userDiagnostics.short: Collects and checks user diagnostic data.
userDiagnostics.long: You can generate a diagnostic link to send to users experiencing similar issues with a specific domain, list generated links, and view the collected data for a specific link. You can also export results.

create.short: Generates a diagnostic link for you to share with users of a particular URL or IP acceleration hostname experiencing similar issues.
create.long: Generates a diagnostic link for you to share with users of a particular URL or IP acceleration hostname experiencing similar issues. After a user clicks the link, the tool gathers necessary diagnostic data and asks the user to submit it. Once submitted, you can check the collected data with the 'user-diagnostics get' command. Each link is valid for 7 days of 50 submissions.
create.defaultError: Failed to generate the diagnostic link.
create.url: URL of which the users are experiencing issues. You need to provide either this flag or '--ipa-hostname'.
create.ipaHostname: IP acceleration hostname of which the users are experiencing issues. You need to provide either this flag or '--url'. To list available IPA hostnames, run the 'ipa-hostnames' command.
create.notes: Optional. Notes about the group or issues experienced by group's users.

missing.url: Missing the required '--url' flag. Add the flag and try again.
missing.any: Missing one of the required flags, either '--url' or '--ipa-hostname'. Add the flag and try again.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.exclusive: Invalid combination of flags. You need to provide only one of these flags, either '--url' and '--ipa-hostname'.

list.short: Lists overview of created diagnostic links.
list.long: Lists overview of created diagnostic links. To get the details of a specific link and collected data, run the 'user-diagnostics get' command using the returned link ID.
list.defaultError: Failed to get the list of diagnostic links.
list.url: Optional. Specific URL to filter the list for.
list.active: Optional. Filters the list for only active links. Active links can be further shared with users to collect more diagnostic data. Each link is valid for 7 days or 50 submissions.
list.user: Optional. Username who created the diagnostic link to filter the list for.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.

get.short: Lists users' diagnostic data submitted using a specific diagnostic link.
get.long: Lists users' diagnostic data submitted using a specific diagnostic link.
get.defaultError: Failed to get collected diagnostic data.
get.linkId: ID of the generated diagnostic link. To get this value, run the 'user-diagnostics list' command.
get.mtr: Optional. Includes MTR output in the response.
get.dig: Optional. Includes dig output in the response.
get.curl: Optional. Includes cURL output in the response.

translateUrl.short: Fetches basic information about an Akamaized URL (ARL), such as typecode, origin server, content provider (CP) code, serial number, and time to live (TTL).
translateUrl.long: Fetches basic information about an Akamaized URL (ARL), such as typecode, origin server, content provider (CP) code, serial number, and time to live (TTL). A URL becomes an ARL once it's on an edge server.
translateUrl.url: Akamaized URL you want to get the details for.

invalid.url: Invalid ARL value. Verify the input and try again.

urlHealthCheck.short: Retrieves data necessary to troubleshoot issues with a URL or ARL.
urlHealthCheck.long: The URL health check scenario retrieves data necessary to debug a URL or ARL. It simultaneously runs the 'grep', 'dig', 'mtr', and 'curl' commands. The data include DNS information, HTTP response, response headers, edge logs, and MTR response.
urlHealthCheck.defaultError: Failed to run the URL health check.
urlHealthCheck.clientLocation: Optional. Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your users. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command first.
urlHealthCheck.edgeServerIp: Optional. IP of an edge server you want to run the URL health check from. You can use the edge server IP value from the 'answerSection' array in the 'dig' command response.
urlHealthCheck.port: Optional. Port number for the URL health check to use, either '80' and '443'. By default set to '80'. Provide only for commands with the '--network-connectivity' flag.
urlHealthCheck.packetType: Optional. Packet type for MTR to use, either 'TCP' or 'ICMP'. By default set to 'TCP'. Provide only for commands with the '--network-connectivity' flag.
urlHealthCheck.ipVersion: Optional. IP version for the cURL to use, either 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. By default set to 'IPv4'.
urlHealthCheck.queryType: Optional. DNS record type you want to get. Possible values are: 'A', 'AAAA', 'SOA', 'CNAME', 'PTR', 'MX', 'NS', 'TXT', 'SRV', 'CAA', and 'ANY'. By default set to 'A'.
urlHealthCheck.requestHeader: Optional. Customized headers for the cURL request in the format 'header: value'. You can provide multiple values.
urlHealthCheck.logs: Optional. Includes results of the 'grep' command.
urlHealthCheck.networkConnectivity: Optional. Includes results of the 'mtr' command.
urlHealthCheck.runFromSiteShieldMap: Optional. Runs the command from Site Shield.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.

missing.Any: Missing one of the required flags, either '--url' or '--edge-location'. Add the flag and try again.

invalid.edgeServerIp: Invalid edge server IP value. Verify the input and try again. To verify if an IP is an edge server IP, run the 'verify-ip' command.
invalid.packetType: Invalid packet type value. Available values are 'TCP' or 'ICMP'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.edgeLocation: Invalid edge server location value. Verify the input and try again. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command.
invalid.queryType: Invalid query type value. Available values are: 'A', 'AAAA', 'SOA', 'CNAME', 'PTR', 'MX', 'NS', 'TXT', 'SRV', 'CAA', and 'ANY'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.port: Invalid port value. Available values are '80' or '443'. Verify the input and try again.

translateErrorString.short: Returns details, including logs, about an error with a specific reference code.
translateErrorString.long: Returns details, including logs, about an error with a specific reference code. You can get data from either the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. Provide only the alphanumerical part of the error. For example, for 'Reference #9.6f64d440.1318965461.2f2b078', enter '9.6f64d440.1318965461.2f2b078'.
translateErrorString.errorString: Alphanumeric part of the error reference code you want to get the data for.
translateErrorString.traceForwardLogs: Optional. Returns logs from all edge servers serving the reference code.

edgeLocations.short: Lists active edge server locations you can use to run diagnostic tools.
edgeLocations.long: Lists active edge server locations you can use to run 'curl', 'dig', 'mtr', 'url-health-check', 'connectivity-problem' and 'content-problem' commands.
edgeLocations.search: Optional. Specific region to filter the list for.

ipaHostnames.long: Lists active IP acceleration hostnames you can use in the 'user-diagnostics create' command.

gtmHostnames.short: Lists active GTM hostnames and test and target IPs for specific hostnames
gtmHostnames.long: Lists active GTM hostnames and test and target IPs for specific hostnames. You can use the results to run 'mtr' and 'dig' commands for a GTM hostname.
gtmHostnames.defaultErrorTestTargetIp: Failed to get test and target IPs.
gtmHostnames.testTargetIp: Optional. GTM hostname you want to get test and target IPs for. Test and target IPs or hostnames are required to run the 'mtr' command for a GTM hostname.

mtr.short: Uses MTR to provide information about the packets loss and latency between an edge server IP or location and a remote destination.
mtr.long: Uses MTR to provide information about the packets loss and latency between an edge server IP or location and a remote destination. To run this command for a GTM hostname, provide 'source' (test IP), 'destination' (target IP), and 'gtmHostname'. To run this command for a Site Shield hostname, provide 'site-shield-hostname', 'destination' and, optionally, 'source'.
mtr.source: MTR source, either an edge server IP or edge server location ID. For a GTM hostname, enter a hostname's test IP returned by the 'gtm-hostnames' command. For a Site Shield hostname, this value is optional.
mtr.destination: MTR destination, either a domain name or an IP address. For a GTM hostname, enter a hostname's target IP returned by the 'gtm-hostnames' command. For a Site Shield hostname as the source, enter a target IP address.
mtr.packetType: Optional. Packet type for MTR to use, either 'TCP' or 'ICMP'. By default set to 'TCP'.
mtr.port: Optional. Port number for MTR to use, either '80' and '443'. By default set to '80'. Provide it only for destination set to a domain name.
mtr.gtmHostname: Optional. GTM hostname to use as the MTR source. Enter the GTM hostname value returned by the 'gtm-hostnames' command.
mtr.ipVersion: Optional. IP version for the MTR to use, either 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. By default set to 'IPV4'. Provide it only for destination set to a domain name.
mtr.siteShieldHostname: Optional. Site Shield hostname to use as the MTR source.

missing.source: Missing source data. Provide the '--source' flag and try again.
missing.destination: Missing destination data. Provide the '--destination' flag and try again.

invalid.any: Invalid combination of flags. Refer to the usage and examples and try again.
invalid.port: Invalid port value. Available values are '80' or '443'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.packetType: Invalid packet type value. Available values are 'TCP' or 'ICMP'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.gtmScenario: Invalid input for a GTM hostname. Provide '--source', '--destination', and '--gtm-hostname'. Where '--source' is the test IP, '--destination' the target IP or hostname, and '--gtm-hostname' a valid GTM hostname. To get these values run the 'gtm-hostnames' command.
invalid.destination: Invalid destination input. For Site Shield hostname, the destination is a valid IP. Verify the input and try again.

redundant.ipVersion: Redundant '--ipVersion' flag. Remove it and try again.
redundant.port: Redundant '--port' flag. Remove it and try again.

grep.short: Uses the GREP command to return logs for an edge server IP from either the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions.
grep.long: Uses the GREP command to return logs for an edge server IP from either the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. Logs provide low-level details on how each request was handled, which you can use to troubleshoot caching and performance issues and to ensure the correct set of Akamai features was applied to the traffic.
grep.hostname: Hostname you want to get the logs for. Provide either this flag or '--cp-code'.
grep.cpCode: CP code you want to get the logs for. Provide either this flag or '--hostname'.
grep.clientIp: Optional. Client IP to filters the logs for. You can provide multiple values.
grep.userAgent: Optional. User agent to filters the logs for. You can provide multiple values.
grep.httpStatusCode: Optional. HTTP status code to filters the logs for. You can provide multiple values. Provide either this flag or '--error-status-codes'.
grep.errorStatusCodes: Optional. Error HTTP status codes, all excluding 2xx, to filters the logs for. You can provide multiple values. Provide either this flag or '--http-status-code'.
grep.arl: Optional. Akamaized URL to filters the logs for. You can provide multiple values.
grep.r: Optional. Filters the logs for requests from clientâ€™s machine to an edge server. Used by default. You can combine it with the '--f' flag.
grep.f: Optional. Filters the logs for requests between edge and origin servers. You can combine it with the '--r' flag.

invalid.edgeServerIp: Invalid edge server IP value. Verify the input and try again. To verify if an IP is an edge server IP, run the 'verify-ip' command.

missing.any: Missing one of the required flags, either '--cp-code' or '--hostname'. Add the flag and try again.

invalid.exclusive: Invalid combination of flags. You need to provide only one of these flags, either '--cp-code' and '--hostname'.
invalid.hostname: Invalid hostname. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.clientIp: Invalid client IP. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.time: One of the values is invalid, either start or end time. Make sure the input follows the ISO 8601 format and try again.
invalid.exclusiveHttpStatusCode: Invalid combination of flags. You need to provide only one of these flags, either '--http-status-code' or '--error-status-codes'.

connectivityProblem.short: Collects diagnostic data for a URL required to troubleshoot connectivity issues, such as slow download and high response time.
connectivityProblem.long: The Connectivity problems scenario collects diagnostic data for a URL required to troubleshoot connectivity issues, such as slow download and high response time. It simultaneously runs the 'grep', 'mtr', and 'curl' commands. The data include edge logs, DNS information, and MTR response.
connectivityProblem.clientLocation: Optional. Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your users. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command first.
connectivityProblem.edgeServerIp: Optional. IP of an edge server to use to run the command. If you don't know if an IP is the edge IP, run the 'verify-ip' command. You can use the edge server IP value from collected diagnostic data.
connectivityProblem.clientIp: Optional. Client IP for Connectivity problems to start MTR from. You can use the edge server IP value from collected diagnostic data.
connectivityProblem.requestHeader: Optional. Customized headers for the cURL request in the format 'header: value'. You can provide multiple values.
connectivityProblem.ipVersion: Optional. IP version for the cURL to use, either 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. By default set to 'IPv4'.
connectivityProblem.packetType: Optional. Packet type for MTR to use, either 'TCP' or 'ICMP'. By default set to 'TCP'.
connectivityProblem.port: Optional. Port number for MTR to use, either '80' and '443'. By default set to '80'.
connectivityProblem.runFromSiteShieldMap: Optional. Runs the command from Site Shield.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.

invalid.edgeServerIp: Invalid edge server IP value. Verify the input and try again. To verify if an IP is an edge server IP, run the 'verify-ip' command.
invalid.clientIp: Invalid client IP. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.port: Invalid port value. Available values are '80' or '443'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.packetType: Invalid packet type value. Available values are 'TCP' or 'ICMP'. Verify the input and try again.
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. Verify the input and try again.

contentProblem.short: Collects diagnostic data for a URL required to troubleshoot content issues, such as missing or incorrect objects or stale content being served and partial download.
contentProblem.long: The Content problems scenario collects diagnostic data for a URL required to troubleshoot content issues, such as missing or incorrect objects or stale content being served and partial download. It simultaneously runs the 'grep' and 'curl' commands. The data include edge logs and DNS information.
contentProblem.clientLocation: Optional. Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your users. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command first.
contentProblem.edgeServerIp: Optional. IP of an edge server to use to run the command. If you don't know if an IP is the edge IP, run the 'verify-ip' command. You can use the edge server IP value from collected diagnostic data.
contentProblem.requestHeader: Optional. Customized headers for the cURL request in the format 'header: value'. You can provide multiple values.
contentProblem.ipVersion: Optional. IP version for the cURL to use, either 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. By default set to 'IPv4'.
contentProblem.runFromSiteShieldMap: Optional. Runs the command from Site Shield.

invalid.url: Invalid URL value. Verify the input and try again.

invalid.edgeServerIp: Invalid edge server IP value. Verify the input and try again. To verify if an IP is an edge server IP, run the 'verify-ip' command.
invalid.edgeLocation: Invalid edge server location value. Verify the input and try again. To get the value, run the 'edge-locations' command.
invalid.ipVersion: Invalid IP version value. Available values are 'IPV4' or 'IPV6'. Verify the input and try again.
